6F9B245E11FE4116A61DEFFA15418B64.description:
examine the application of the law of conservation of momentum in one dimension in a variety of
situations involving two objects (e.g., rear-end collision, recoil, jumping from a boat, traffic
accidents, two people on skates pushing each other)

78BC32B250054FB0BAC759650D97C6EC.description:
compare the functioning of first- and second-generation air bags and explain the need to improve
the design of air bags (e.g., the design of first-generation air bags assumed drivers to be adult
males who were not wearing seat belts; for the second-generation design, these assumptions
were revised to reduce speed and force of air bag deployment)

374AD0169CF54B188577B7D414451591.description:
examine data and strategies comparing vehicle occupant injuries, for belted and unbelted
occupants, before and after seat belt legislation

3617016E8D2842CC87C019B5BA4EB67A.description:
examine how seat belts and air bags function in terms of momentum and dispersal of force (e.g.,
explain why one cannot brace for a collision as a means of protection, explain why babies must
be placed in special seats and not on a passenger’s lap)

7A12FECAF44C45BCBCDDD79B8F59DE0C.description:
apply the principles underlying the motion of objects to explain the need for safety devices and
practices

7CECA57F85C14104AF37A94A4386B3AB.description:
compare the death and injury rate in motor vehicle accidents to other causes of death and injury
among adults and teenagers

6E6F50D7DE2049548CD99FA81D3A6DCD.description: identify the dangers faced by individuals in a motor vehicle accident

537D2B5ADD324E849DA09D1DBD5FDD9A.description: list the ways passengers can protect themselves from injury in accidents

DAAD85DF1EAE4846BFF581549E9137CF.description:
list traffic safety factors (e.g., reasons why some traffic lights stay yellow for three seconds and
others for five seconds, reasons why some traffic lights have advanced warning flashers, speed
bumps, guardrails, rumble strips)

24002A1D9FA340F3877CC637FEAAD0F2.description: discuss the consequences of a shorter or longer reaction time

796D727171E54F2CA353984C54725DB4.description:
examine the need to stay a safe distance behind another automobile when travelling at highway
speeds (e.g., maintaining a two-second gap under normal driving conditions)

627C8EB8A82F4652860D1E5805900285.description:
list the factors influencing the ability to make sudden stops (e.g., degree of wakefulness, visual
acuity, state of mind, road and weather conditions)

23980A56FC634FB886D26985FDFCE08B.description:
distinguish between scientific evidence and personal opinion to examine the need for safety systems
and regulations

4ECCD9AC7E41440FB408E6ECADA2485F.description: identify the role of chromosomes in determining the sex of human offspring

30EB87DF581D40AEA36B1802BDE4CC1E.description:
describe the role of genes in inherited characteristics (e.g., hitchhiker’s thumb, earlobe
attachment; hair, skin and eye colour)

CCDADEEF02A241A8989E6A89CC472B39.description: describe the role of genes in inherited characteristics and human health

7A86C149281343C3A8987232023FDD0F.description:
investigate how the overuse and improper use of antibiotics may lead to the development of
resistance in bacteria (e.g., use of prescription antibiotics for viral infections)

D379984D69E84529BC408C111AD6DBAA.description:
investigate how different antibiotic therapies, vaccines or medications are used to treat or prevent
a disease (e.g., measles, rabies, tetanus, smallpox, tuberculosis)

F1EC02587189433CB3860F8D83E589D6.description:
describe, in general terms, how the immune system protects the body by attacking foreign or
abnormal proteins

B0B12E582C8240AFA2D359B0C6B75F22.description:
investigate the role of blood components (e.g., white blood cells and antibodies) in controlling
pathogens

9CCBAC73E50B445EBA7B9E829A006FC8.description:
examine the role of the human organism’s physical defences in preventing infection by
disease-causing agents (e.g., skin, mucus membranes, tears, saliva, digestive system)

A7BB4D68DAC24BEE98D1140C16D1DC8C.description: examine the natural mechanisms that protect the human organism from disease-causing agents

A76CBC05FFD04709804EF61DFA5D0B52.description:
investigate how a specific food-handling or preparation process is designed to prevent microbial
contamination of the final product (e.g., freezing, pickling, salting, vacuum packaging and
radiation)

8E0563BEE01647D9BFE19FC1923AF76A.description:
examine how noncommunicable diseases are transmitted and how they affect human health (e.g.,
food poisoning due to Salmonella or E. coli, cholera, dysentery)

A416B5F631AE4B03B2EA3927EE2BDD3B.description:
describe how different communicable diseases are transmitted and how they affect human health
(e.g., common cold, influenza)

AE7687BD8FC04985A5C8A5393280F260.description:
investigate the conditions necessary for the growth of a specific disease-causing agent (e.g.,
viruses, fungi, bacteria)

CF2A5CF7365F47268095F52FB6744D53.description: distinguish between communicable and noncommunicable diseases

FEA5DA53CFA3446BBCFF0CEC57DB7029.description: examine the relationship between human health and environmental disease-causing agents

0C7E472B57574AFE86A24C6F644C8489.description:
examine the impact of public health initiatives and the maintenance of high standards of personal
hygiene in fostering healthier societies and individuals (e.g., provision of potable water, clean air
standards, treatment of human and animal wastes, safe handling of food)

D89E6C91F7F4445F8823F66AD918DD75.description:
examine, from a historical perspective, the connection between diseases and contaminated
drinking water, air pollution and personal hygiene

D8AA2D2321E94B618F045820AFCCC85C.description:
list the social and economic impact of pandemic diseases on past and present societies (e.g.,
Black Death; 1918 Influenza; severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS); impact of European
diseases, such as tuberculosis, on Canada’s First Nations communities)

32DC7B032E0842CF90A0CF6DF445CCD1.description:
examine the relationship between social conditions and disease (e.g., hunger and malnutrition;
sanitation and bacterial, viral, fungal diseases)

6C7EE5C7B49B419B8D1F111752BA8C13.description:
describe, in general terms, how human diseases may arise from an interaction of variables,
including poor nutrition, stress, disease-causing agents and environmental contamination

7A20453DF0F940BC9AD9583859E39E2A.description:
describe how human health is affected by environmental factors and describe the need for action by
society to improve human health

2E7C063ECC88498498E471409C367F11.description:
assess the importance of combustion reactions to a modern industrial society and describe the
implications of depleting fossil fuel reserves

334AABBC6CD843A6A1101F0757FEBAB5.description: assess the impact of fossil fuel-based technologies on the environment

5F18C81BFFDF401EA3B9E2C794CD3F8C.description: examine the sources of fossil fuels and the extraction and refining processes

46112738F0574905B37962AC43319744.description:
compare present fossil fuel consumption, by industry, homes and automobiles, with projected
consumption in the future

B86B70E0EFC7404F9EC4E44EDDD21250.description: explain the importance of the fossil fuel industry in Alberta in meeting energy requirements

9F878293ED3F4B2F9EE6E4A693D156E0.description: examine the impact of fossil fuel-based technologies and their importance in meeting human needs

96D7628D3EBF41DDA117D9AC639785D8.description: examine the formation of fossil fuels (e.g., oil, coal and natural gas)

132EE0370D76496B84B76EF09EEAB027.description:
examine the factors that affect metabolism (e.g., age, level of fitness, time of day, exercise/
activity) and compare daily energy requirements of individuals at various stages of growth and
activity levels (e.g., energy requirements of a newborn, teenager, office worker and labourer;
energy requirements while sleeping, running)

112A59CA6B994FB1AD695E174A433DBB.description:
identify the sources of energy in food (e.g., carbohydrates, fats and protein) and explain, in
general terms, why there needs to be a balance between food intake and energy output

49FF62CF20AD4EA690B8EAF395E60473.description:
describe food as fuel for the human body (e.g., meeting its needs for normal metabolic functions,
exercise and growth or repair of cells)

F6E306AE7588451F85D980AFC6A87CE6.description:
examine the process of respiration in which glucose and oxygen are converted to energy, carbon
dioxide and water

33B75664817045F3B9642D3EB986CE31.description:
examine and list the requirements of photosynthesis (e.g., carbon dioxide, water, chlorophyll in
chloroplasts and sunlight)

8B8EEDF640D64F98A023755600838B48.description:
investigate the common chemical reactions that produce or absorb energy (e.g., light and heat
emitted by the combustion of fossil fuels, cold and hot packs)

1429722ED16547BC87AAD3B6CA4AD4BE.description: investigate the energy conversions associated with change in chemical and biological systems

422CABBC1D9B4B3D9F2FBA97D0C72DF3.description:
devise a plan for making more efficient use of household energy conversion devices (e.g., use of
full loads in a dishwasher or clothes dryer, use of appropriate wattage light bulbs or compact
fluorescent light bulbs)

CCF29A8652E4461E9ABD84A3660564FC.description: examine why the useful output energy in machines is always less than the input energy

F53CB9D972CD4B78A039A89AC47A90B3.description:
compare the efficiency of electrical power distribution systems by tracing the energy conversions
that occur in a variety of household devices (e.g., power tools, electric automobiles, microwave
and conventional ovens, fluorescent and halogen light bulbs)

212D4991C6224CEB8DE2DFDB60BFBE6D.description:
examine electrical power generation in terms of converting thermal/hydro/wind/solar/nuclear
energy into electricity

FEF60EEF47F54E1F8A8911D9040D7630.description:
investigate electrical energy conversion devices in terms of energy conversions, rate of energy
transfer and efficiency

D8F3DAF6518C455A9B7F6001FD841821.description:
examine the law of conservation of energy to trace energy transformation, dissipation and
availability in physical and technological systems (e.g., swinging pendulum)

33DADBF1D0F2494E892E67C99FEA8695.description:
describe an energy transformation system in terms of input, converter and output (e.g., an
electric kettle)

2622D59774D84921A1E8445E2F0C2D56.description:
design, construct and evaluate a simple model or device that transforms energy from one form to
another (e.g., windmill, water wheel, model vehicle powered by rubber bands/mousetraps/
carbon dioxide/electric motor)

F4DD585B47F04E78B4974F37FAB869D3.description:
investigate evidence of energy transformations in the home and everyday contexts (e.g., simple
machines, electrical devices, chemical reactions)

0E8BC433F8154BAAA10FF076487F7063.description:
investigate and interpret the transformation and conservation of various forms of energy in physical
and technological systems

F42C2D5A0FD040FBB77E4663D81E4FF5.description: examine technologies used to reduce the emissions that cause acid deposition.

70D015C4CBF04D38BC5ABCBE089D8881.description:
examine greenhouse gases and air pollution resulting from combustion reactions (e.g., carbon
dioxide and carbon monoxide released when methane is burned in a household furnace)

F70E9728085340F4BBC0CC332CAA6315.description:
give possible examples of how technology has addressed the problem of corrosion (e.g., protect
with paint, oil, plastic or metal; use alloys)

7FD03FE212CE44469A0E92B8BB0F6B6F.description:
investigate chemical processes occurring in everyday life (e.g., acid-base reactions in cleaning
and food processing, dyeing hair, washing clothes, gasoline combustion in an automobile
engine, swimming pool maintenance, rusting metal)

44B32E5FF2AA4444B0CB23739CF34B79.description:
examine common acid-base neutralization reactions (e.g., neutralization of stomach acid by
antacids, use of lemon juice on fish dishes)

B1D1CAA123CF4E00B9E3EFD45B73F19E.description:
examine common technological products and processes encountered in everyday life and the
workplace and examine their potential effects on the environment

5653A504E3CE49C6A9B2F6768D20A0DA.description:
identify simple composition, decomposition, combustion and neutralization reactions when they
are given word and/or chemical equations, products and reactant

353C3A45572748749125BFEFF5053E62.description:
investigate and classify simple composition and decomposition reactions (e.g., tarnishing of
silver, electrolysis of water)

3F57A9368A1F4834BD57FB6C1F9A8194.description:
investigate and classify endothermic and exothermic reactions (e.g., chemicals mixing in a cold
pack, burning natural gas)

F05EEDFEA2E84FDAB02A870E97424E77.description: investigate the changes to reactants and products in fossil fuel combustion and rusting reactions

A32DA31ADDE94B55B25169D099239992.description:
investigate and identify evidence of chemical change (e.g., change of phase, appearance, colour,
odour, energy such as heat and light)

1655D037DEC34DC0AB02D586C8E7BAB6.description:
understand the relationship among chemical formulas, composition and name (e.g., simple acids,
bases, salts)

86DBA5D45D9947B9BB4EBFF587BADA6D.description:
name simple compounds from chemical formulas and recognize the names of substances that are
used every day

E8046B9F9B334127951C3F5CDCD8CFCA.description:
identify and apply appropriate safety standards at home, in the workplace and in the community
when using chemicals, including the WHMIS and HHPS

50AC515A20814D96B00DC2AB735B20EE.description:
identify examples of the chemical changes involved in cooking, cleaning, personal care and
gardening (e.g., acids in vinegar, citrus fruits and rhubarb react with aluminum kitchen
cookware; bases in drain cleaners react with grease; pesticides interfere with metabolic
processes in living systems)

0EA9975DB18D4673BAAB96E22A31C616.description:
identify common materials and their uses and describe how everyday life has changed over the
past 100 years with the development of new materials (e.g., acids, bases, alloys, plastics,
ceramics, fibres, composites)

14FF9D9017EC4F6890C9EFFB32285BD2.description:
identify how everyday life depends upon technological products and processes that produce useful
materials and energy

7E42A2DB798740509833376AC3F06924.description: Applications of Matter and Chemical Change
